statements: SELECT * FROM appointments;

SELECT description, count(*) FROM appointments GROUP BY description
SELECT id, COUNT(*) FROM appointments GROUP BY appointment_date HAVING COUNT(*) > 1
SELECT appointment_date, MONTH(appointment_date) AS month FROM appointments
SELECT * FROM appointments JOIN case_details ON appointments.case_id = case_details.case_id
SELECT id, appointment_date FROM appointments LEFT JOIN case_details ON appointments.case_id = case_details.case_id

SELECT id, appointment_date FROM appointments WHERE appointment_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2023-01-01'

SELECT court_location FROM legal_matters WHERE case_id = 789
SELECT * FROM deadlines WHERE case_id IN (SELECT case_id FROM legal_matters WHERE attorney = 'Mary Smith')
SELECT appointment_date, notes FROM appointments WHERE case_id = (SELECT case_id FROM legal_matters WHERE case_type = 'divorce')

SELECT * FROM deadlines WHERE case_id = 1;
SELECT description, deadline_date FROM deadlines WHERE deadline_date > '2022-01-01';

SELECT appointment_date, location FROM appointments WHERE case_id = 5;

SELECT appointment_date, location, notes FROM appointments WHERE notes LIKE '%urgent%';

SELECT * FROM deadlines d JOIN appointments a ON d.case_id = a.case_id;
SELECT appointment_date, location, attorney FROM appointments a JOIN legal_matters l ON a.case_id = l.case_id;
SELECT l.case_name, a.appointment_date, d.deadline_date FROM legal_matters l JOIN appointments a ON l.case_id = a.case_id JOIN deadlines d ON l.case_id = d.case_id;
SELECT MAX(deadline_date) AS latest_deadline FROM deadlines;
SELECT MIN(appointment_date) AS earliest_appointment FROM appointments;
SELECT AVG(appointment_id) AS average_appointment_id FROM appointments;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_cases FROM legal_matters;
SELECT description, COUNT(*) AS total_deadlines FROM deadlines GROUP BY description;
SELECT attorney, COUNT(*) AS total_cases FROM legal_matters GROUP BY attorney;
SELECT SUM(appointment_id) AS total_appointment_id FROM appointments;
SELECT AVG(appointment_id) AS average_appointment_id, MAX(appointment_id) AS max_appointment_id FROM appointments;
SELECT case_id, description, appointment_date FROM deadlines d LEFT JOIN appointments a ON d.case_id = a.case_id WHERE description IS NOT NULL AND appointment_date IS NOT NULL;

SELECT name, specialization FROM lawyers;
SELECT contact_number FROM lawyers;
SELECT deadline_id, case_id, deadline_date, description FROM deadlines;
SELECT case_id, case_name, case_type, case_status FROM court_cases;
SELECT appointment_id, case_id, appointment_date, location FROM appointments;
SELECT lawyer_id, name, specialization, contact_number FROM lawyers;
SELECT deadlines.deadline_id, court_cases.case_id, appointments.appointment_id, lawyers.lawyer_id FROM deadlines, court_cases, appointments, lawyers;
SELECT * FROM deadlines WHERE deadline_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM court_cases WHERE case_status = 'Open';
SELECT * FROM appointments WHERE location = 'Courtroom A';
SELECT * FROM lawyers WHERE specialization = 'Criminal Law';
SELECT * FROM deadlines ORDER BY deadline_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM deadlines WHERE deadline_date > '2022-01-01'
SELECT d.case_id, d.description, c.case_name FROM deadlines d JOIN court_cases c ON d.case_id = c.case_id
SELECT a.appointment_date, a.location, c.case_name FROM appointments a JOIN court_cases c ON a.case_id = c.case_id
SELECT l.name, l.specialization, c.case_name FROM lawyers l JOIN court_cases c ON l.lawyer_id = c.case_id
SELECT * FROM deadlines ORDER BY deadline_date DESC
SELECT d.case_id, COUNT(*) AS num_deadlines FROM deadlines d GROUP BY d.case_id
SELECT a.appointment_date, l.name AS lawyer_name FROM appointments a JOIN lawyers l ON a.case_id = l.lawyer_id
SELECT * FROM court_cases WHERE case_status = 'active'
SELECT c.case_name, COUNT(*) AS num_appointments FROM court_cases c JOIN appointments a ON c.case_id = a.case_id GROUP BY c.case_id
SELECT l.name, COUNT(*) AS num_cases FROM lawyers l JOIN court_cases c ON l.lawyer_id = c.case_id GROUP BY l.lawyer_id
SELECT * FROM CourtCases;
SELECT case_name, case_deadline FROM CourtCases;
SELECT * FROM Lawyers;
SELECT lawyer_name, lawyer_email FROM Lawyers;
SELECT * FROM Clients;
SELECT client_name, client_phone FROM Clients;
SELECT * FROM Appointments;
SELECT appointment_id, appointment_date FROM Appointments;
SELECT * FROM Deadlines;
SELECT deadline_id, deadline_date FROM Deadlines;
SELECT c.case_name, l.lawyer_name, cl.client_name FROM CourtCases c, Lawyers l, Clients cl WHERE c.case_id = 1 AND l.lawyer_id = 1 AND cl.client_id = 1;
SELECT c.case_name, l.lawyer_name, cl.client_name FROM CourtCases c INNER JOIN Lawyers l ON c.case_id = l.lawyer_id INNER JOIN Clients cl ON c.case_id = cl.client_id;
SELECT c.case_name, a.appointment_date FROM CourtCases c INNER JOIN Appointments a ON c.case_id = a.case_id;
SELECT l.lawyer_name, a.appointment_date FROM Lawyers l INNER JOIN Appointments a ON l.lawyer_id = a.lawyer_id;
SELECT cl.client_name, a.appointment_date FROM Clients cl INNER JOIN Appointments a ON cl.client_id = a.client_id;
SELECT c.case_name, d.deadline_date FROM CourtCases c INNER JOIN Deadlines d ON c.case_id = d.case_id;

SELECT c.case_name, l.lawyer_name, cl.client_name, a.appointment_date, d.deadline_date FROM CourtCases c INNER JOIN Lawyers l ON c.case_id = l.lawyer_id INNER JOIN Clients cl ON c.case_id = cl.client_id INNER JOIN Appointments a ON c.case_id = a.case_id INNER JOIN Deadlines d ON c.case_id = d.case_id;
SELECT c.case_name, COUNT(a.appointment_id) AS num_appointments FROM CourtCases c LEFT JOIN Appointments a ON c.case_id = a.case_id GROUP BY c.case_name;
SELECT l.lawyer_name, COUNT(a.appointment_id) AS num_appointments FROM Lawyers l LEFT JOIN Appointments a ON l.lawyer_id = a.lawyer_id GROUP BY l.lawyer_name;
SELECT cl.client_name, COUNT(a.appointment_id) AS num_appointments FROM Clients cl LEFT JOIN Appointments a ON cl.client_id = a.client_id GROUP BY cl.client_name;

SELECT c.case_name, AVG(DATEDIFF(d.deadline_date, a.appointment_date)) AS avg_days_to_deadline FROM CourtCases c INNER JOIN Deadlines d ON c.case_id = d.case_id INNER JOIN Appointments a ON c.case_id = a.case_id;
SELECT * FROM CourtCases
SELECT case_name, case_description FROM CourtCases
SELECT Lawyers.lawyer_name, Clients.client_name FROM Lawyers, Clients
SELECT Lawyers.lawyer_name, Clients.client_name FROM Lawyers JOIN Clients ON Lawyers.lawyer_id = Clients.client_id
SELECT CourtCases.case_name, Appointments.appointment_date FROM CourtCases JOIN Appointments ON CourtCases.case_id = Appointments.case_id
SELECT CourtCases.case_name, Lawyers.lawyer_name FROM CourtCases JOIN Appointments ON CourtCases.case_id = Appointments.case_id JOIN Lawyers ON Appointments.lawyer_id = Lawyers.lawyer_id

SELECT case_name, lawyer_name, client_name FROM CourtCases JOIN Appointments ON CourtCases.case_id = Appointments.case_id JOIN Lawyers ON Appointments.lawyer_id = Lawyers.lawyer_id JOIN Clients ON Appointments.client_id = Clients.client_id
SELECT client_name, deadline_date FROM Clients JOIN Deadlines ON Clients.client_id = Deadlines.client_id
